fields.description:
Hi,

Even if a branch is merged to master SourceTree sometimes show it unmerged.

!image-2017-11-03-13-20-42-086.png!

The same branch displayed with GitExtensions:

!image-2017-11-03-13-21-51-811.png!

Of course when user tries to merge it to master it fails as its already integrated.

This misrepresentation is really harmful as we're not sure to the see the real state of the repo.

Regards,

Bertrand
fields.summary: Wrong branch display

fields.description: A bunch of tabs were lost during the upgrade to 2.3.5 and again (after upgrading) during a system restart. They do not seem to be lost when you merely restart ST itself.
fields.summary: Lost tabs

fields.description:
Let's say you are working on a sub-module repository and you make changes and commit the new changes.

Let's also say you happen to have some changes to files in the parent repo.

Looking at the parent repo you will see in the staging area; the sub-module changes to its SHA, and changes to any files you made in the parent repo, good so-far.

 

Now if you were to create / checkout a new branch in the parent repo, the parent repo file changes will still persist in the staging area, *but the sub-module SHA changes have been reverted to the previous commit the parent repo had it pointing to* (the new commit(s) is still there, but HEAD is not on it.)
fields.summary: Checking out a new branch will reset any sub-module commit changes

fields.description: When Sourcetree is windowed, the window cannot be resized from the top-left or top-right corners. I didn't realize how frequently I resize windows from the top-right corner until I couldn't do it for Sourcetree.
fields.summary: Cannot resize window from top corners

fields.description: reported on twitter: https://twitter.com/Roar_G/statuses/926020219096698880
fields.summary: NPS prompts multiple times

fields.description:
I am seeing the following issues when adding and accessing local repositories from the + tab.
 # When I create a local repository folder and giving it a name the name often times will revert back to "New Folder". I was even able to see this happen after I gave it a name then drug and dropped a local repository folder in the folder and as soon as I dropped it, the name reverted back.
 # Another issue I see often is that my folders I have created disappear after I close the tab of the last project within that folder, so I am constantly having to recreate folders.
 # The all repos folder shows lots of repositories, some duplicated and some listed as missing. In either case I can never delete them. If I choose delete from the context menu it doesn't do anything.

!Sourcetree (179).png!
fields.summary: Local Repository Folder Issues

fields.description:
h3. Behavior in Google Chrome:
 # Navigate to the repository in Bitbucket Cloud
 # Click the Clone action
 # Click "Clone in SourceTree"
 # Chrome starts SourceTree but it crashes

 

In the sourcetree log there are two types of exceptions.

If the SourceTree is running it records this exception:

ERROR [2017-11-02 09:17:53,163] [1] [SourceTree.App] [.ctor] - finish EnsureSquirrelExecutionStubIsCopied
ERROR [2017-11-02 09:17:53,771] [1] [SourceTree.App] [OnStartup] - Failed to start
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
 at SourceTree.Host.Bitbucket.BitbucketHost.GetCanonicalUri(IConfigurationManager configurationManager)
 at SourceTree.Host.Bitbucket.BitbucketHost.get_CanonicalUrl()
 at SourceTree.AppRoot.HandleExtendedIntegrationUrl(Boolean isFirstInstance, String url)
 at SourceTree.AppRoot.ProcessArguments(Boolean isFirstInstance)
 at SourceTree.AppRoot.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs e)
 at SourceTree.App.OnStartup(StartupEventArgs e)
ERROR [2017-11-02 09:18:13,315] [1] [SourceTree.App] [.ctor] - finish EnsureSquirrelExecutionStubIsCopied

 

If the SourceTree is not running it records this exception:


ERROR [2017-11-02 09:18:15,038] [1] [SourceTree.App] [OnStartup] - Failed to start
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
 at SourceTree.Host.Bitbucket.BitbucketHost.GetCanonicalUri(IConfigurationManager configurationManager)
 at SourceTree.Host.Bitbucket.BitbucketHost.get_CanonicalUrl()
 at SourceTree.AppRoot.HandleExtendedIntegrationUrl(Boolean isFirstInstance, String url)
 at SourceTree.AppRoot.ProcessArguments(Boolean isFirstInstance)
 at SourceTree.AppRoot.DoWindowStartupTasks()
 at SourceTree.ViewModel.MainWindowViewModel..ctor(IRepositoryTabContainerViewModel repositoryTabContainerViewModel, ICustomActionsManager customActionsManager, IRepositoryManager repositoryManager, IAnalyticsDataManager analyticsDataManager, ITraceManager traceManager, IDispatcher dispatcher, IAccountManager accountManager, IFailureHandler failureHandler, IDvcsManager dvcsManager, IConfigurationManager configurationManager, IInstanceManager instanceManager, ISchedulerManager schedulerManager, IWebManager webManager, IRepositoryMonitorManager repositoryMonitorManager, ISshKeyManager sshKeyManager, INotificationsManager notificationsManager, IPreferencesManager preferencesManager)
 at SourceTree.MainWindow..ctor(IRepositoryTabContainerViewModel repositoryTabContainerViewModel, ICustomActionsManager customActionsManager, IRepositoryManager repositoryManager, IAnalyticsDataManager analyticsDataManager, ITraceManager traceManager, IDispatcher dispatcher, IAccountManager accountManager, IFailureHandler failureHandler, IDvcsManager dvcsManager, IConfigurationManager configurationManager, IInstanceManager instanceManager, ISchedulerManager schedulerManager, IWebManager webManager, IRepositoryMonitorManager repositoryMonitorManager, IApplicationManager applicationManager, ISshKeyManager sshKeyManager, INotificationsManager notificationsManager, IBookmarkManager bookmarkManager, IPreferencesManager preferencesManager)

I have tried the suggested method but it doesn't work:

 # Uncheck "Use this version of SourceTree for URI association" (second box from the top)
 # Click OK
 # Go back into Tools->Options->General-tab
 # Check "Use this version of SourceTree for URI association"
 # Click OK.

fields.description: Right now, the Stash Changes dialog box has only one option, "Keep staged changes." Please add a second one: "Include untracked files," e.g., the equivalent (when checked) of *--include-untracked* on a *git stash save* command. I almost never want to stash changes without including untracked (e.g., new) files.
fields.summary: Add checkbox to include untracked files when stashing

fields.description: Hello! What did I notice is that latest versions of SourceTree on Win and Mac have a different order of action buttons in the top menu. Screenshots attached. Wouldn't it be better to have them ordered one way on both platforms? Just got confused, because I automatically clicked the first button on Win which meant "Push" instead of "Pull" action on Mac.
fields.summary: Wrong order of action icons

fields.description: I have done as clean of an install as I could with both 2.3.1 and 2.3.5, first doing an uninstall then by removing the Atlassian and SourceTree folders from C:\Users\\{username}\AppData\Local.  When I get to the Atlassian Account portion of the install and enter my email and password then click the button, the progress wheel on the button only spins.  I can leave it on this screen indefinitely and it will not continue past.  Since I have uninstalled SourceTree to fix a bug in 2.3.1, I cannot use SourceTree until this is resolved.  I was hoping with the bug fixes in 2.3.5 that the issue I am experiencing would disappear.
fields.summary: Can't Login to Atlassian Account After Installation

fields.description: I don't understand why the osx version has such different behavior than the windows version..  For instance, I would really like to see the Confirm Staging option, as found in the osx version. This can be critical if you are dealing with hundreds of files, and accidentally click stage all, instead of stage selected - which may lead to a lot of lost time if you have carefully selected specific hunks that you have already staged.
fields.summary: Missing confirm staging option and a lot of other functionality from osx version

fields.description:
If I update the git repository of the submodule of my project, It's not updated in automatic when I do the `Pull` command...

a way to solve this is use a command like this:

`git submodule update --init --force --remote`

 

but is not a good way to use it
fields.summary: submodules update in pull

fields.description: If I set, into the clone page, a local folder that contains `/`, when the clone has completed, the repository is unde the `[root]` folder, need to put manually
fields.summary: In clone, if I use a Local folder with / it doesn't appear

fields.description:
My problems started when I cleared out my [user@bitbucket.org|mailto:user@bitbucket.org] account from Authentication tab of 2.3.4( I think - it was the version directly before 2.3.5 that came out today). I did this, because when I installed the latest version, I was asked to sign in with Google, so I was under the impression that I had no need to manage my old [user@bitbucket.org|mailto:user@bitbucket.org] id - which I also am no longer maintaining the password for, so I can't see why we'd need to keep it.
{code:java}
remote: Invalid username or password. If you log in via a third party service you must ensure you have an account password set in your account profile.{code}
To fix this issue, I tried to add OAuth credentials, which did appear to work and appeared in the list and was showing my profile picture, but when I tried to do a Fetch, I got the same errors because my repositories clearly still refer to the old [user@bitbucket.org
|mailto:user@bitbucket.org]

I also tried adding an app password, as generated within my Bitbucket account, no change.

I then googled around and found that I should have been able to add the [user@bitbucket.org|mailto:user@bitbucket.org] id, but specify my Atlassian password - that failed to make any difference

The only way I could fix this, was by following the advice on a forum to revert to (and staying on) [2.0.20.1|https://downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourceTreeSetup-2.0.20.1.exe] - then, the above use of Atlassian password works completely fine as it should. The latest version that came out today, 2.3.5, is also broken, and will then show me the errors above.
fields.summary: Cannot use SourceTree with Google authentication since removing pre-merge user@bitbucket.org credentials

Optional extended integration. look at the g ... the lower arc is cut off

fields.description:
SourceTree for Windows appears to be forgetting the "extended integration settings" for repositories' remotes. I'm not sure if it affects all "host types", but my organization uses Stash, and it seems to reset itself not long after being set. I started noticing this ever since version 2.3 of the client shipped-- at least _on my machine_. Prior to version 2.3, I never had any issues with this feature.

From what I can tell, the settings don't get lost immediately, but usually after a day or so of using the client. I haven't been able to pinpoint what exactly causes them to be erased.
fields.summary: Client not retaining repositories' extended integration settings

I tried to open source tree from icon on desktop, but nothing happened.

I have tried with both ways uninstall old version then install new version and upgrading from old version, it's same issue.

I had to install back version 2.1.2.2.

!image-2017-10-25-09-51-18-363.png!

fields.summary: Refresh is really slow when multiple tabs are open on startup

fields.description:
I decided to upgrade my Version 1.9 Source Tree to Version 2.3.1.

I did so to find that my cached password was old and needed to be reset.

I navigated to the Options > Authentication Tab.

Source Tree Version 2.3.1 Does Not Display My Saved Password for My GIT Host.

There is no way to update my password using Version 2.3.1.

I tried doing a Git Fetch from the Git Bash thinking this might help.

I was prompted and I was able to access the Git Origin successfully from the Bash but that did nothing to update my cached credential after specifying my new password.

The only way I was able to change my password was to reinstall Version 1.9 where I still could see my cached Host Password.  There I could either Edit or Delete that Credential and be prompted to enter a new password.

Once I did that I was able to open SourceTree 2.3.1 and interact with my Git Origin.

I wasted 2 hours out of my morning playing around with this. 

I am surprised this is not a wide spread issue.

I am not doing anything special here. 

I have not tweaked anything or done anything special with GIT
fields.summary: Unable to change password in SourceTree 2.3.1

fields.description:
After adding a subtree into a repository, Sourcetree always shows that there are uncommitted changes. Launching the terminal window and executing 'git status' confirms that the repository is clean. After pushing the changes (the addition of the subtree) to origin and then pulling them onto a different PC, Sourcetree on the different PC doesn't display the uncommitted changes. This is a major distraction when using subtrees with Sourcetree!

Version 1.6.23 of Sourcetree on the PC where the subtree was added does NOT falsely show the uncommitted changes.
fields.summary: Uncommitted changes always always shown after adding subtree
Cannot push Hg changes

fields.description:
see: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/External-Diff-Merge-Tool-Arguments/qaq-p/657494]




Hi, I'm using SourceTree 2.3.1.0.

I use external diff/merge(LVCompare, LVMerge) tool to work with my LabVIEW files. These external tools need the absolute path of the files I want to compare/merge.

But somehow, I think the arguments I use ($PWD $BASE $REMOTE $LOCAL $MERGED) doesn't output correct absolute path to my external tools. They just output relative path.

I remember at previous version(maybe at 1.x.x.x), these work fine. I've launch external tools perfectly before.

 

Please help, thanks!
fields.summary: Diff/Merge external tools aren't provided with full paths

Windows updated and sourceTree no longer opens, tried to install the latest version from your site and nothing appears to install. Sadly back to version 1.9, any stable version on 2.X?

Funny enough after installing version 1.9, I got a message saying that you should delete these files from your AppData and that fixed it. Maybe those checks should be restored in version 2.x or maybe they are happening at the wrong time.

fields.description:
*Problem*
 Git Flow behaviour differs from preview result as well as same actions performed using SourceTree on OSX.

*Steps to reproduce*
 # Create empty repository and commit initial file to repo.
 # Initialize Git Flow using default settings
 # Start new Hotfix
 # Finish hotfix

The Hotfix is correctly merged into the *master* branch. However the hotfix is also merged from the *master* branch into *develop* in stead of the expected result: merged from the *hotfix* branch into the *develop* branch.

See the attached screenshots of the taken steps.
fields.summary: SourceTree Git Flow erratic behaviour

fields.description:
Adding an existing repository to a newly created-and-renamed folder doesn't pick up the new name in the drop down box for the folder in the Add Repository pane.

It continues to display "New Folder" for the folder which it was just renamed.

To reproduce:
 * Open a new tab
 * Click "Add Folder"
 * Right click on the "New Folder"
 * Select "Rename"
 * Input AAAAA in the text editor and hit Enter
 * Click the "Add" icon
 * Open the "Local Folder" dropdown

Expected result: The list contains an "AAAAA" entry

Actual resutl: The list contains a "New Folder" entry

 

Furthermore, selecting the "New Folder" entry and completing the repository add will not put the repository in any folder.
fields.summary: Renamed folders are not listed in repo-adding page

fields.description: See the attached screenshots for visual explanation.
fields.summary: New Tab -> Add (local repository) should use the current selected folder as 'Local Folder' by default

fields.description:
Added a second remote to repo (this is a fork of the origin repo)

Checked out a branch of fork remote

Now the 'Push changes immediately' on any commit anywhere always points to fork/current-branch instead of origin/current-branch

The push option from the top bar defaults to origin as expected.

A little thing but ever so annoying

The story continues:
 * added a new local branch: commit pushes return to origin on all branches except the one tracking the fork
 * pulled the fork remote's branch: commit pushes now back to remote on all branches that also exist in fork. On the newly created branch that doesn't exist in fork, push goes to origin
 * create another local branch: commit pushes go back to expected remote on all branches

screenshots to follow
fields.summary: Commit: push changes immediately to wrong remote

fields.description: Please add file counts to the frontend so I can see how many files are affected by the commit.
fields.summary: File counts

fields.description:
I started the installer (without going "as adnimistrator") .The installer just dies. Before dying, it creates the folders:

%LOCALAPPDATA%\Atlassian\SourceTree

%LOCALAPPDATA%\Atlassian\SourceTree.exe_Url_3npl2u2iod1eyk1jve1uhrr1sig1ig0i\2.3.1.0

In sourcetree.log I see:

ERROR [2017-10-17 12:13:16,061] [1] [SourceTree.App] [OnStartup] - Failed to start
 System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
 at SourceTree.Notifications.NotificationsManager.SetOwner(NotificationDialogWindow notificationWindow)

Please find the full sourcetree.log attached.

In a second attempt I removed the %LOCALAPPDATA%\Atlassian folder, and ran the installer "As Administrator". It still crashed in the same way.

 UPDATE: I tried older versions.
 * SourceTreeSetup-2.2.4.0.exe *crashed* in the same way.
 * SourceTreeSetup-2.1.10.0.exe installed *without crashing*
fields.summary: SourceTreeSetup-2.3.1.0.exe crashes in NotificationsManager.SetOwner

fields.description:
I'm going to use the word "Branch" a lot, and all in different contexts, so I will try to be as clear as possible.

 

If I use the branch button (below)

!branch1.PNG!

The branches tree 

!image-2017-10-16-10-10-29-424.png!

 

Collapses. It would be great if it didn't do this; I want to be able to see my list of branches at all times.
fields.summary: 'Branches' tree menu collapses randomly and inappropriately

fields.description:
* I download Sourcetree
 * prompted to register or sign in with an existing account
 * I enter my email
 * Redirected to Google's OAuth
 * enter email + password
 * 2-step verification: prompted to enter in verification code sent to my phone
 * enter the code correctly
 * dialogue window loads for < 2 seconds and then freezes
fields.summary: Google Authentication freezes during two-step verification

fields.description:
The Windows 10 notification that pops out from the lower-right of the screen (on my machine) which says 'Tell us what you think' does not do anything when clicked.

This does not affect the function of SourceTree in any way but I thought you might like to know about it.

It could, of course, just be something wrong with the Windows setup on my machine.
fields.summary: Windows 10 notification to 'Tell us what you think' does not do anything when clicked.

fields.description:
After starting the update on the Update tab in the settings dialog the error occurred:
*{color:red}WriteEntryTo or OpenEntryStream can only be called once.{color}*

The same problem occurred also updating from a previous version to 2.3.1.0 (reported on the Sourcetree beta forums):
https://groups.google.com/d/msg/atlassian-sourcetree-beta/80SptIHzbaQ/gCfgOAJcBAAJ

Since the update problems are one of the more troubling issues we have seen I would rate this a major issue even if it cannot be reproduced on all machines.
fields.summary: Update version of Sourcetree shows error 'WriteEntryTo or OpenEntryStream can only be called once'

Running the setup, it gets to the Account information. A dialog box to enter the account information appears, but the dialog is totally empty. There is no text, buttons, or places to fill in the account information.

I tried to attach a screenshot, and got a message "JIRA coould not attach the file. There is a missing token."

 

I tried to create a log. Since the install did not complete,the log was not created.

fields.description:
Currently, to view files in an External Diff tool, you have to do either:
 # Right-click file in Log / History tab.
 # Click Log Selected.
 # Wait for Log Selected form to display.
 # Right-click commit in the Log Selected form.
 # Click External Diff.

Or:
 # Select file in Log / History Tab.
 # Click the gears dropdown button on the right side of the window.
 # Click External Diff.

The second approach is an improvement over the first, but there should really be an "External Diff" option in the Log / History tab context menu, so you would only have to do this:
 # Right-click file in Log / History tab.
 # Click External Diff.
fields.summary: Add External Diff to Log / History tab context menu

fields.description: When installing, I am asked for my sourcetree/Atlassian account in order to proceed. After signing in, nothing happens: the installer sits on the same "Atlassian account" page. I download my license, but can't do anything with it because the installer doesn't provide an option.
fields.summary: Can't install

fields.description:
Try to launch SourceTree on Windows 10 Pro (Version 10.0.15063 Build 15063) and it will not start.

There is an exception shown in the logs attached.

 

Note. I have tried deleting the _AppData\Local\SourceTree_ folder. Installed both 2.2.4 and 2.3.1 again and both of them exhibit this issue.
fields.summary: SourceTree does not start

fields.description:
Currently if I select a commit from 'Log / History' or 'Search' tabs, there is no way (expect looking at branch lines in 'Log / History') to know which branch that was committed to.

Can we have an extra line between *Commit* and *Parents* fields - *Branch*?
fields.summary: Show branch name in commit details

fields.description:
Currently if I want to search for some commits I have to switch to 'Search' tab which otherwise very similar to 'Log / History' tab.

It would be more convenient to have an option to search directly from 'Log / History' tab - this will also allow to apply additional filtering already available from that tab, e.g. 'All Branches' vs 'Current Branch'.
fields.summary: Integrate search within 'Log / History'

fields.description:
After updating Sourcetree to version 2.3.1 the application will not start.

Application reinstallation will not help.

I was not able to find Uninstall entry on Programs and Features list, so tried to delete following folders and reinstall, but it didn't help as well

$\{LOCALAPPDATA}\Atlassian\SourceTree\

$\{LOCALAPPDATA}\SourceTree\

 

Logs entry with DEBUG flags is attached.
fields.summary: Sourcetree 2.3.1 will not start on Windows 10

fields.description: During an install when a user enters Atlassian login credentials, a blank screen appears and installation can not continue.
fields.summary: SourceTree for Windows Will Not Install!

fields.description:
Fresh install of SourceTree.  Via downloading an installer, as well as using Chocolatey.  
 # Tick both boxes in *License Agreement* and click *Continue*.
 # Under *Atlassian account*, I click *Use an existing account*.
 # In the new window that opens, I key in my email address (mike.loux@doverfs.com) and click *Continue*.
 # I briefly see something about "single sign on" (which we do not yet have enabled), before the screen goes blank.
 # Stuck at white screen forever.
 # Close everything and uninstall in disgust.

NOTES:
 # After looking at similar bugs, I followed the suggestions I could find (which mostly involved IE 11 and registry hacks).  In all cases, the hacks were either already in place, or did absolutely nothing. I think this might be a different issue from what those folks are seeing, however, since they did not mention being presented with credentials, but rather getting the white screen right after clicking *Use an existing account* (whereas I was able to key in an email address).
 # Just for grins, I tried doing the recover account thing.  Which did nothing (and the captcha process was really annoying).  I can log into my account on the web server just fine.  And using command-line git works fine as well, but I'm testing this for a bunch of people, not all of whom will want to do command line git fu.
fields.summary: Install - Use an existing account - Enter credentials - white screen of death

fields.description:
Our System-Engineering team updated our gitlab-Server today. After that Sourcetree didn't connect to the server any more.

Todays gitlab update included a change where they disabled SSH1. As the included plink version was pretty old we tried using a current one. After the update Sourcetree was able to connect to the server as expected
fields.summary: Please update bundled putty/plink

fields.description: Working with source tree and bitbucket, we replaced a self-signed certificate for a GoDaddy certificate, but sourcetree still dosnt allow us to work with the option "Disable SSL Certificate validation" unchecked , doesn't  recognize GoDaddy certificate, thinks its self signed.
fields.summary: Sourcetree working with GoDaddy certificate on bitbucket, not reconized as not self signed

fields.description:
After installing SourceTree on Windows 10 Pro 64-bit, requiring admin account to install, SourceTree will not run using standard Windows account.  Instead must right-click on desktop icon and use "Run as administrator".

I find this annoying as I have to type in the admin password every time I wish to start SourceTree.
fields.summary: SourceTree will not launch using Standard account.  Requires run-as admin
App crash on startup

fields.description:
After specifying a starting repository I got a password dialog.

As I'll be using ssh keys I don't want to enter my password and decided to cancel.

Now the program alternates between these two messages

[https://i.imgur.com/dyPMTeb.png]

[https://i.imgur.com/2dzjKtO.png]

cancel should cancel the checkout of a staring repo, instead of the retry it currently does.
fields.summary: SourceTree install, initial checkout can't be canceld

fields.description:
steps to reproduce:

1. select multiple files in "unstaged files".
2. click "Stage Selected".
fields.summary: diff pane shows incorrect diff info after multiple files were staged at once.

fields.description:
When a merge conflicts happens after I pull I would expect that the default merge message appears in the commit window. Instead the commit window is empty. If I change tab to "Log / History" and back to "File Status" the default merge message is shown.

Please see attached video.

Because SourceTree does no longer shown a warning when a merge conflicts occeurs this has lead to teammembers not realising that they are in a merge conflict situation and thus discared the changes instead of continue with the merge commit.
fields.summary: Default Merge commit message is only shown after tab switch

fields.description:
When you merge one branch into another you and get a merge conflict it will show you the list of files changed by the merge attempt.

If you were to go into the staged files and unstage a hunk or line then view the unstaged file diff it will show you *ALL* of the merged changes, not the single change you unstaged.

This is a problem with the Diff as opening up the terminal and typing *_git diff_* will correctly show the single change you unstaged.

 

...please, Please PLEASE *PLEASE* do proper testing before releasing new versions. I have 14 (now 15) bug reports open for issues that have been INTRODUCED within the last few months... consider hiring people to test your software as it seems like there's no-one doing this except your users.
fields.summary: Merge conflict Diff view shows incorrect Diff
"Fetch branch" removes branch prefix (e.g. feature/)

fields.description:
After switching from local tab to remote, and then back to local, filtering of local repos doesnt work

Steps

 # Switch to Remote ([https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/j5b5bgz874c4p68/SourceTree_2017-10-05_08-58-11.png)]
 # Switch back to local
 # Filtering doesnt work now

Atlasslian Source-Tree 2.1.2.5 not able to register on install.

I now have two users with this issue, all basic trouble shooting has been done (reinstall/clear internet settings etc).

Has anyone else seen this?

 

Please [add Harpreet.Singh@macquarie.com|mailto:add%C2%A0Harpreet.Singh@macquarie.com] into this JIRA .

fields.description:
Hi Support,

Currently there is no way to get list of all active pull request of particular Bitbucket Project. Currently I have 9-10 repository in a Project and I have to navigate to each repository to check active pull requests.
Please have functionality to get list of all active pull request of projects so that we don't have to navigate to each repos.

Reference Question : 
https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Git-questions/How-to-get-list-of-active-Pull-Requests-for-particular-Bitbucket/qaq-p/645880#M1286

Thanks,
Hardik
